conclusion: Forces acting on the carton just after it is laid on the belt: weight mg, normal force N, kinetic-friction force fₖ = μ₁mg.
Horizontal acceleration while it is still slipping is a = μ₁g = 2 m/s² to the right.
Initial velocity of the carton is v₁₀ = 0, and the belt velocity it must reach is v₀ = 2 m/s.
Time it slips before being carried along without further slipping is t₁ = 1 s.
Distance travelled during the slipping stage is s₁ = 1 m.
Total distance to the right end is L₁ = 6 m.
Remaining distance once it moves together with the belt is s₂ = 5 m.
Time to cover the remaining distance at the belt speed is t₂ = 2.5 s.
Total time from left end to right end is t = 3.5 s.
Final answers: Acceleration immediately after being put on the belt is 2 m/s² to the right, and time required to travel from the left end to the right end is 3.5 s.
